item.title: Everything announced during Day of the Devs TGA 2024 edition
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2024/12/11/everything-announced-during-day-of-the-devs-tga-2024-edition/

Day of the Devs has become an indie game showcase institution, looking to highlight games both big and small, expected and unexpected. It comes around twice a year, tying in with Summer Games Fest and The Game Awards, and this year’s pre-TGA 2024 show is packed with some great games.

Watch the full stream here, or scroll for all the games and headlines.

Faraway by Little Eyes

Be a shooting star just trying to pass through the galaxy and connect up other pinpricks of light into constellations. There’s an endlessly replayable main mode, as well as two puzzle modes.

Ultimate Sheep Raccoon by Clear Endeavour Games

The bike racing sequel to Ultimate Chicken Horse looks just as wild and silly as that platforming party game… Now with bikes and up to 8 players.

Sleight of Hand by RiffRaff Games

Get a fresh look at the stealth action deckbuilder, with Lady Luck taking on a dark case in Steeple City, unleashing magical card abilities to get past guards and sneak through the world.

Coming to PC and Xbox Series X|S, and with Game Pass.

Demon Tides by Fabrazz

A successor to Demon Turf, Demon Tides is another 3D platformer that leans in on loads of character transformations for moves. These will let you really zip around the worlds very fast, using talismans to add new abilities, equipping up to 5 at a time.

Kingmakers by Redemption Road

Go back in time to medieval England but with modern weapons, trying to unite the country and save the world. Fight with machine guns in hand, but then build cities and castles, and use them as staging points to raise armies and conquer. There’s support for up to 4 player co-op, and it’s coming to PC in 2025.

Recur by AstraLogical

A puzzle game with just a little bit of Braid to it, Recur casts you as a postman looking to get past all manner of wild and explosive challenges, using the ability to wind time back and forth in sync with your movement from left to right, or right to left.

Blue Prince by Dogubomb

Say this one out loud. Blue Prince is a house-building puzzler, in which you fill out a 5×9 floorplan with unique rooms, trying to make it further and deeper through the grid to find room 46. It’s a real mind-bender, that’s for sure.

Incolatus Don’t Stop Girlypop! by Funny Fintan Softworks

Y2K girly pop is back in this luridly colourful shooter that’s about going as fast and over the top as possible. Bunny hop to go faster, and the faster you go the bigger your guns get and the more scopes they have. Oh and there’s a dressup metagame where you use different materials and colours to customise your arms… and just your arms.

LOK Digital by Letibus Design & Icedrop Game

The LOK puzzle book has been translated into a digital game, and it’s out now! Learn a new and completely made up language one work at a time by playing an invented language word search of sorts. Out today for PC and mobile next year.

Neon Abyss 2 by Veewo Games

A sequel to the 2020 roguelike run ‘n’ gunner, Neon Abyss 2 ramps everything up even further. Coming to Early Access in 2025.

Cresent County by Electric Saint

Hop on your motorbroom and work during the day before going undergroun motorbroom racing at night. Make deliveries, herd sheep, fix lay lines, and then use the money to trick out your broom, go racing, and flirt with your rivals.

The first play test is out now on Steam and itch.io.

PBJ – The Musical by Kami Box

A video game musical about peanut butter & jelly sandwiches, narrated by kids reading Shakespeare, featuring art made of real cut out paper collages, and music by Britain’s Got Talent 2015 semi-finalist Lorraine Bowen!

Curiosmos – Céline & the Silly Stars

Build your own solar system around a star from scratch, creating planets out of stardust, then heading down to the 2D planet surfaces and making mountains, valleys, volcanos and more. You can even kickstart life and evolution…. and then yeet it into the void. Oh, and there’s a black hole a few lightyears away.

Bionic Bay by Psychoflow Studio & Mureena Oy

A side-scrolling platforming adventure in the vein of Limbo and its ilk, Bionic Bay’s hook is your growing ability to shift gravity and power, control time, teleport and swap places with objects, run around with clones, and so much more.

This is coming to PS5 and PC on 13th March 2025.

Inkobini by Nagai Industries

Stock the shelves at a small town convenience store in Japan. You can pick up every item, move things around however you like, and get to learn a little bit about the patrons by what they buy and how they react to, for example, you putting bread in the fridge.

Feltopia by Wooly Games

A fully hand-felted stop motion shoot ’em up that works in reverse. You’re not trying to blow up enemies, but blast their blackened husks back into life, turning them into butterflied, for example. Blast your way through to save the Rainbow Flock and gain their abilities. You can wishlist now with the game set for 2026.

Blippo+ by YACHT, Telefantasy Studios & Panic

Ever thought your TV needed fewer bits? What about only one? That’s Blippo+

Hyper Light Breaker by Heart Machine

This co-op third person roguelite prequel to Hyper Light Drifter is entering Steam Early Access in January 2025.

Tankhead by Alpha Channel

Out right now via Epic Games Store, this off-beat tank combat game casts you as a little drone that you’ve uploaded your mind into. Head out into the ECA quarantine zone and fight for survival against enemy vehicles, chipping away at their armour to blast weakspots, while trying to hide and shield your own. Then scavenge all their parts.

Also there’s really weird as heck bosses.

That’s the show! Did anything stand out for you?
